measure.name: precooling
measure.description: This measure adjusts cooling schedules by a user specified number of degrees for the specified time period of a day. User can also specify the start and end date for the adjustment. This is applied throughout the entire building.
measure.modeler_description: This measure will clone all of the schedules that are used for cooling setpoints for thermal zones. The clones are hooked up to the thermostat in place of the original schedules. Then the schedules are adjusted by the specified values. HVAC operation schedule will also be changed. There is a checkbox to determine if the thermostat for design days should be altered.

argument.name: cooling_adjustment
argument.display_name: Degrees Fahrenheit to Adjust Cooling Setpoint By
argument.description: Use negative value for reducing cooling setpoint during precooling period

argument.name: start_date1
argument.display_name: First start date for precooling

argument.name: end_date1
argument.display_name: First end date for precooling

argument.name: start_date2
argument.display_name: Second start date for precooling (optional)
argument.description: Specify a date in MM-DD format if you want a second season of precooling; leave blank if not needed.

argument.name: end_date2
argument.display_name: Second end date for precooling
argument.description: Specify a date in MM-DD format if you want a second season of precooling; leave blank if not needed. If either the start or end date is blank, the period is considered not used.

argument.name: start_date3
argument.display_name: Third start date for precooling (optional)
argument.description: Specify a date in MM-DD format if you want a third season of precooling; leave blank if not needed.

argument.name: end_date3
argument.display_name: Third end date for precooling
argument.description: Specify a date in MM-DD format if you want a third season of precooling; leave blank if not needed. If either the start or end date is blank, the period is considered not used.

argument.name: start_date4
argument.display_name: Fourth start date for precooling (optional)
argument.description: Specify a date in MM-DD format if you want a fourth season of precooling; leave blank if not needed.

argument.name: end_date4
argument.display_name: Fourth end date for precooling
argument.description: Specify a date in MM-DD format if you want a fourth season of precooling; leave blank if not needed. If either the start or end date is blank, the period is considered not used.

argument.name: start_date5
argument.display_name: Fifth start date for precooling (optional)
argument.description: Specify a date in MM-DD format if you want a fifth season of precooling; leave blank if not needed.

argument.name: end_date5
argument.display_name: Fifth end date for precooling
argument.description: Specify a date in MM-DD format if you want a fifth season of precooling; leave blank if not needed. If either the start or end date is blank, the period is considered not used.

argument.name: start_time1
argument.display_name: Start time of precooling for the first season

argument.name: end_time1
argument.display_name: End time of precooling for the first season

argument.name: start_time2
argument.display_name: Start time of precooling for the second season (optional)

argument.name: end_time2
argument.display_name: End time of precooling for the second season (optional)

argument.name: start_time3
argument.display_name: Start time of precooling for the third season (optional)

argument.name: end_time3
argument.display_name: End time of precooling for the third season (optional)

argument.name: start_time4
argument.display_name: Start time of precooling for the fourth season (optional)

argument.name: end_time4
argument.display_name: End time of precooling for the fourth season (optional)

argument.name: start_time5
argument.display_name: Start time of precooling for the fifth season (optional)

argument.name: end_time5
argument.display_name: End time of precooling for the fifth season (optional)

argument.name: alt_periods
argument.display_name: Use alternative default start and end time based on the state of the model from the Cambium load profile peak period?
argument.description: This will overwrite the start and end time and date provided by the user
